:
   "There are 4.7 percent of Virginians who are minimum wage earners who are
   over 25 years of age working full-time and trying to raise a family."

"There are 4.7 percent of Virginians who are minimum wage earners who are
   over 25 years of age working full-time and trying to raise a family," he
   said during the Feb. 11 floor debate on a bill that would have raised the
   wage over two years to $9.25 an hour.

In raw numbers, the BLS estimates 1.8 million Virginians were hourly
   earners in 2012 and, of them, 123,000 were paid the minimum wage or less.

Our rating

   Obenshain said 4.7 percent of Virginians are minimum wage earners older
   than 25 raising families.
